detaileddescription.para: The transport to the nRF Cloud is established.
In the process of connecting to nRF Cloud.
There was a request from nRF Cloud to associate the device with a user on the nRF Cloud.
The device is successfully associated with a user.
The device can now start sending sensor data to the cloud.
The device received non-specific data from the cloud.
The device received location data from the cloud and no response callback was registered.
The device received shadow related data from the cloud.
The device has received a ping response from the cloud.
The data sent to the cloud was acknowledged.
The transport was disconnected. The status field in the event struct will be populated with a nrf_cloud_disconnect_status value.
A FOTA update has started.
The device should be restarted to apply a firmware upgrade
An error occurred during the FOTA update.
An error occurred when connecting to the nRF Cloud. The status field in the event struct will be populated with a nrf_cloud_connect_result value.
An error occurred. The status field in the event struct will be populated with a nrf_cloud_error_status value.

briefdescription.para: Asynchronous nRF Cloud events notified by the module.

detaileddescription.para: No error
MQTT connection failed
MQTT protocol version not supported by server
MQTT client identifier rejected by server
MQTT service is unavailable
Malformed user name or password
Client is not authorized to connect
Failed to subscribe to MQTT topic
Error processing A-GPS data
Error processing P-GPS data

briefdescription.para: nRF Cloud error status, used to describe NRF_CLOUD_EVT_ERROR event.

detaileddescription.para: Disconnect was requested by user/application
Disconnect was caused by the cloud
Socket received POLLNVAL event
Socket poll returned an error value or POLLERR event

briefdescription.para: nRF Cloud disconnect status, used to describe NRF_CLOUD_EVT_TRANSPORT_DISCONNECTED event.

detaileddescription.para: The connection was successful
The library is not initialized; nrf_cloud_init
A network error ocurred
A connection error occurred relating to the nRF Cloud backend
The connection failed due to an indeterminate reason
Insufficient memory is available
Invalid private key
Invalid CA or client cert
Other cert issue
Timeout, SIM card may be out of data
The connection exists

briefdescription.para: nRF Cloud connect result. Used as return value for nrf_cloud_connect() and to describe NRF_CLOUD_EVT_TRANSPORT_CONNECT_ERROR event.
nRF Cloud error codes. See the Error Codes section of nRF Cloud API documentation for more information.

detaileddescription.para: The GNSS sensor on the device.
The FLIP movement sensor on the device.
The Button press sensor on the device.
The TEMP sensor on the device.
The Humidity sensor on the device.
The Air Pressure sensor on the device.
The Air Quality sensor on the device.
The RSPR data obtained from the modem.
The descriptive DEVICE data indicating its status.
The light sensor on the device.

briefdescription.para: Sensor types supported by the nRF Cloud.

detaileddescription.para: Endpoint used to update the cloud-side device shadow state .
Endpoint used to directly message the nRF Cloud Web UI.

Endpoint used to publish bulk messages to nRF Cloud. Bulk messages combine multiple messages into a single message that will be unwrapped and re-published to the message topic in the nRF Cloud backend.

briefdescription.para: Topic types supported by nRF Cloud.
FOTA status reported to nRF Cloud.

detaileddescription.para: Application update.
Delta modem update
Bootloader update.
Full modem update

briefdescription.para: FOTA update type.

detaileddescription.para: No FOTA update in progress
The FOTA update has not yet been validated
Validation succeeded
Validation failed
Validation result could not be determined
The validation process is finished
An error occurred before validation

briefdescription.para: Validity of an in-progress/installed FOTA update.

detaileddescription.para: Initial state
Indicates if the NRF_CLOUD_FOTA_BL_STATUS_S0_WAS_ACTIVE flag has been updated
Indicates if slot 0 was active prior to the update
Indicates if the planned reboot has occurred during the update install process

briefdescription.para: Status flags for tracking the update process of the b1 bootloader (MCUBOOT)

detaileddescription.para: Data will not be modified
Data will be set/updated
Data section will be cleared

briefdescription.para: How the info sections are handled when encoding shadow data.

detaileddescription.para: Invalid data type
Specifies a data type of nrf_cloud_gnss_pvt
Specifies a data type of nrf_cloud_gnss_nmea
Specifies a data type of nrf_modem_gnss_pvt_data_frame
Specifies a data type of nrf_modem_gnss_nmea_data_frame

briefdescription.para: GNSS data type contained in nrf_cloud_gnss_data.

detaileddescription.para: Data not present in shadow.
This was not a delta, so no need to send update back.
Send shadow update confirmation back.

briefdescription.para: How the control section is handled when either a trimmed shadow or a delta shadow is received.
Event handler registered with the module to handle asynchronous events from the module.

parameterdescription.para: The event and any associated parameters.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the module.

simplesect.para: This API must be called prior to using nRF Cloud and it must return successfully.

parameterdescription.para: Already initialized or nrf_cloud_uninit is in progress.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Uninitialize nRF Cloud; disconnects cloud connection and cleans up allocated memory.

simplesect.para: If nRF Cloud FOTA is enabled and a FOTA job is active uninit will not be performed.

This function is solely intended to allow this library to be deactivated when no longer needed. You can recover from any error state you may encounter without calling this function. See nrf_cloud_disconnect for a way to reset the nRF Cloud connection state without uninitializing the whole library.

parameterdescription.para: If a FOTA job is in progress.
If the expected disconnect event did not occur.
If CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_CONNECTION_POLL_THREAD is enabled and the connection poll thread did not become inactive.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Connect to the cloud.

detaileddescription.para: The NRF_CLOUD_EVT_TRANSPORT_CONNECTED event indicates that the cloud connection has been established. In any stage of connecting to the cloud, an NRF_CLOUD_EVT_ERROR might be received. If it is received before NRF_CLOUD_EVT_TRANSPORT_CONNECTED, the application may repeat the call to nrf_cloud_connect to try again.

briefdescription.para: Send sensor data reliably.

detaileddescription.para: This API should only be called after receiving an NRF_CLOUD_EVT_READY event. If the API succeeds, you can expect the NRF_CLOUD_EVT_SENSOR_DATA_ACK event for data sent with a valid tag value.

parameterdescription.para: Sensor data; the data pointed to by param->data.ptr must be a string.
Cloud connection is not established; wait for NRF_CLOUD_EVT_READY.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Update the device status in the shadow.

parameterdescription.para: Cloud connection is not established; wait for NRF_CLOUD_EVT_READY.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Stream sensor data. Uses lowest QoS; no acknowledgment,.

detaileddescription.para: This API should only be called after receiving an NRF_CLOUD_EVT_READY event.

parameterdescription.para: Sensor data; tag value is ignored.
Cloud connection is not established; wait for NRF_CLOUD_EVT_READY.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Send data to nRF Cloud.

detaileddescription.para: This API is used to send pre-encoded data to nRF Cloud.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a structure containing data and topic information.
Cloud connection is not established; wait for NRF_CLOUD_EVT_READY.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Disconnect from the cloud.

detaileddescription.para: This API may be called any time after receiving the NRF_CLOUD_EVT_TRANSPORT_CONNECTED event. The NRF_CLOUD_EVT_TRANSPORT_DISCONNECTED event indicates that the disconnect has completed successfully.

parameterdescription.para: Cloud connection is not established; wait for NRF_CLOUD_EVT_TRANSPORT_CONNECTED.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Function that must be called periodically to keep the module functional.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: The application has handled reinit after a modem FOTA update and the LTE link has been reestablished. This function must be called in order to complete the modem update. Depends on CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_FOTA.

parameterdescription.para: true if modem update was successful, false otherwise.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Add service info into the provided cJSON object.

parameterdescription.para: cJSON object to which service info will be added.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Add modem info into the provided cJSON object.

simplesect.para: To add modem info, CONFIG_MODEM_INFO must be enabled.

parameterdescription.para: cJSON object to which modem info will be added.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Function to retrieve the current device ID.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer to receive the device ID.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Function to retrieve the current customer tenant ID.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer to receive the tenant ID.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Function to generate a JWT to be used with nRF Cloud's REST API. This library's configured values for client id and sec tag (NRF_CLOUD_SEC_TAG) will be used for generating the JWT.

parameterdescription.para: How long (seconds) the JWT will be valid. Maximum duration specified by NRF_CLOUD_JWT_VALID_TIME_S_MAX. If zero, NRF_CLOUD_JWT_VALID_TIME_S_DEF will be used.
Size of the buffer (recommended size >= 600 bytes).
Modem does not have valid date/time, JWT not generated.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Function to process/validate a pending FOTA update job. Typically the job information is read from non-volatile storage on startup. This function is intended to be used by custom REST-based FOTA implementations. It is called internally if CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_FOTA is enabled. For pending NRF_CLOUD_FOTA_MODEM_DELTA jobs the modem library must be initialized before calling this function, otherwise the job will be marked as completed without validation.

parameterdescription.para: A reboot is needed to complete a FOTA update.
A Pending FOTA job has been processed.
Error; not configured for FOTA job type.

briefdescription.para: Function to set the active bootloader (B1) slot flag which is needed to validate a bootloader FOTA update. For proper functionality, CONFIG_FOTA_DOWNLOAD must be enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Flag set successfully or not a bootloader FOTA update.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *const buf, const char *const app_id, const char *const msg_type, enum nrf_cloud_error *const err)
memberdef.name: nrf_cloud_handle_error_message

briefdescription.para: Function to check for a JSON error message in data received from nRF Cloud via MQTT.

parameterdescription.para: appId value to check for. Set to NULL to skip appID check.
messageType value to check for. Set to NULL to skip messageType check.
Error code found (and matched app_id and msg_type if provided).
Error code found, but did not match specified app_id and msg_type.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Function to retrieve the FOTA type of a pending FOTA job. A value of NRF_CLOUD_FOTA_TYPE__INVALID indicates that there are no pending FOTA jobs. Depends on CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_FOTA.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Function to validate a pending FOTA installation before initializing this library. This function enables the application to control the reboot/reinit process during FOTA updates. If this function is not called directly by the application, it will be called internally when nrf_cloud_init is executed. For pending NRF_CLOUD_FOTA_MODEM_DELTA jobs the modem library must be initialized before calling this function, otherwise the job will be marked as completed without validation. Depends on CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_FOTA.

parameterdescription.para: FOTA type of pending job. NRF_CLOUD_FOTA_TYPE__INVALID if no pending job. Can be NULL.
Pending FOTA job processed and requires the application to perform a reboot or, for modem FOTA types, reinitialization of the modem library.
Error; failed to load FOTA job info from settings module.

briefdescription.para: Function to set the flash device used for full modem FOTA updates. This function is intended to be used by custom REST-based FOTA implementations. It is called internally when nrf_cloud_init is executed if CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_FOTA is enabled. It can be called before nrf_cloud_init if required by the application.

parameterdescription.para: Flash device has already been set.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

briefdescription.para: Function to install a full modem update from flash. If successful, reboot the device or reinit the modem to complete the update. This function is intended to be used by custom REST-based FOTA implementations. If CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_FOTA is enabled, call nrf_cloud_fota_pending_job_validate to install a downloaded NRF_CLOUD_FOTA_MODEM_FULL update after the NRF_CLOUD_EVT_FOTA_DONE event is received. Depends on CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_FOTA_FULL_MODEM_UPDATE.

parameterdescription.para: Flash device not set; see nrf_cloud_fota_fmfu_dev_set or nrf_cloud_init.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error. Modem update not installed.

briefdescription.para: Function to determine if FOTA type is modem related.

simplesect.para: true if FOTA is modem type, otherwise false.

briefdescription.para: Function to determine if the specified FOTA type is enabled by the configuration. This function returns false if both CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_FOTA and CONFIG_NRF_CLOUD_REST are disabled. REST-based applications are responsible for implementing FOTA updates for all configured types.

parameterdescription.para: Specified FOTA type is enabled by the configuration.
Specified FOTA type is not enabled by the configuration.

briefdescription.para: Add GNSS location data, formatted as an nRF Cloud device message, to the provided cJSON object.

parameterdescription.para: cJSON object to which GNSS data will be added.

simplesect.para: A negative value indicates an error.

detaileddescription.para: MQTT message ID: not specified, use next incremented value
MQTT message ID: subscribe to control channel topics
MQTT message ID: subscribe to data channel topics
MQTT message ID: subscribe to FOTA topics
MQTT message ID: unsubscribe from control channel topics
MQTT message ID: unsubscribe from data channel topics
MQTT message ID: unsubscribe from FOTA topics
MQTT message ID: request device state (shadow)
MQTT message ID: request FOTA job
MQTT message ID: request BLE FOTA job
MQTT message ID: update device state (shadow)
MQTT message ID: set pairing/associated state
MQTT message ID: update FOTA job status
MQTT message ID: update BLE FOTA job status
MQTT message ID: Start of incrementing range
MQTT message ID: End of incrementing range
MQTT message ID: Start of user specified (custom) range
MQTT message ID: End of user specified (custom) range
Determine if an MQTT message ID is a user specified tag to be used for ACK matching
Maximum valid duration for JWTs generated by nrf_cloud_jwt_generate
Default valid duration for JWTs generated by nrf_cloud_jwt_generate
Size of nRF Cloud FOTA job ID; version 4 UUID: 32 bytes, 4 hyphens, NULL
